title: Jonathan’s Victory and Saul’s Rash Oath
summary: Jonathan courageously attacks a Philistine outpost, leading to a major Israelite victory. Meanwhile, Saul makes a foolish oath that no one should eat, causing distress for the army. Jonathan unknowingly breaks the oath but is spared by the people.

faq.question: What did Jonathan do on his own?
faq.answer: He attacked the Philistine outpost with just his armor-bearer, sparking a larger victory.

faq.question: Why was Saul’s oath a problem?
faq.answer: It weakened the army, and Jonathan unknowingly violated it by eating honey.
